alert.note: Alert for Lincoln; Minnehaha (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Sioux Falls (Southeastern SD, Southwestern MN, and Northwestern IA)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 14 at 10:00AM MDT until further notice by NWS Sioux Falls
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in South Dakota...Minnesota... James River at Huron affecting Beadle County. West Fork Des Moines River near Avoca affecting Cottonwood and Murray Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South Dakota...Iowa... James River near Forestburg affecting Sanborn County. Big Sioux River below Dell Rapids affecting Minnehaha County. Big Sioux River above Hawarden affecting Sioux, Lincoln and Union Counties. Big Sioux River near Egan affecting Moody County. Big Sioux River near Richland affecting Plymouth and Union Counties. Big Sioux River at Brandon affecting Lincoln, Minnehaha and Lyon Counties. Big Sioux River near Estelline affecting Brookings and Hamlin Counties. Big Sioux River at Sioux Falls I-90 affecting Minnehaha County. Big Sioux River near Bruce affecting Brookings County. Big Sioux River at Akron affecting Plymouth and Union Counties. Big Sioux River near Brookings affecting Moody and Brookings Counties. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Iowa... Rock River at Rock Rapids affecting Lyon County. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Big Sioux River at Brandon. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 1304.0 feet, significant flooding of crop and pasture land begins. Access to the north end of the Big Sioux Recreation Area on the west side of Brandon is limited. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM CDT Friday the stage was 1304.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:00 AM CDT Friday was 1304.6 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood stage is 1304.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (unknown time) Location Stg Stg Day/Time d1 d2 d3 Big Sioux River Brandon 1304.0 1304.6 Fri 10 am MSG MSG MSG &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday morning.
